intro: Lilaeopsis exigua, commonly known as the narrowleaf marsh grass, is a small, herbaceous plant native to wetland and marsh environments in North America. It typically grows to a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters and has narrow, grass-like leaves that are often slightly hairy. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in loose clusters, which are typically greenish or pale yellow in color. Lilaeopsis exigua is adapted to moist soils and can often be found in areas with standing water or saturated ground. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, supporting various insect and bird life.
